Description: Limestone relief of Khentykai(?): pouring a libation on to a tall altar. There is a hieroglyphic text above. He was the son of the principal figure in the scene to which this block originally belonged. The sunk relief is of fair quality. There has been much surface flaking through the action of salt.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: B. Porter & R. Moss, 'Topographical Bibliography of Ancient Egyptian Hieroglyphic Texts, Reliefs and Paintings' III (Oxford: Clarendon Press), 66; Part 2, 306.
Bibliographic references: James 1961 / Hieroglyphic texts from Egyptian stelae, etc. Part 1 (pl.15)
Condition: Poor; there has been much surface flaking through the action of salt.
